did.abstract: This collection includes the records from the Scottish Brigade Alumnae association and the Scottish Brigade. The series included are: Scottish Brigade Alumnae Records; Scottish Brigade Alumnae Photographic and Video Material; Official Brigade Records; Scottish Brigade Performance Material; Scottish Brigade Photographic Material; Scottish Brigade Publicity Clippings; Stephen F. Austin Senior High School Yearbooks; and Scottish Brigade Memorabilia and Scrapbooks.

bioghist.head: Historical Note:
bioghist.p: The Stephen F. Austin High School Scottish Brigade drill team was founded by Beatrice Lytle in September of 1937. The Scottish Brigade’s mission was defined as service to school and community, as well as embracing the ideals of honor, spirit and loyalty. Drill teams played an important social role in the years that the Scottish Brigade was active. Girls’ sports teams were rare or nonexistent in many American high schools and colleges until the enforcement of Title IX in 1972, and drill teams like the Scottish Brigade offered a place to promote scholarship, discipline, respect, leadership skills, social skills and fitness to high school girls.

For the next forty years the Scottish Brigade performed at Austin High School football games, as well as drill team contests and city and state parades and festivals. The brigade disbanded on May 25, 1978. On the 50th anniversary of the founding of the Scottish Brigade, the alumnae decided to form an association to keep the memory and spirit of the Scottish Brigade alive. In 1987 the Scottish Brigade Alumnae Association formed and is still active providing scholarships to Austin High School students and planning yearly meetings of Brigade alumnae.
Harwood, Nancy. “Scottish Brigade Alumnae members keep the spirit alive” The Leader. Houston, Texas [March 16, 2006].
Bell, Richard C.“A history of women in sport prior to Title IX” The Sport Journal, Vol 10, No. 2 (2007). Accessed on May 19, 2011

custodhist.head: Custodial History:
custodhist.p: The items were donated on behalf of the Scottish Brigade Alumnae Organization, and Nancy Grissom was the Vice Chair at the time of donation.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use:
userestrict.p: Special Collections owns the physical items in our collections, but copyright normally belongs to the creator of the materials or their heirs. The researcher has full responsibility for determining copyright status, locating copyright holders, and abiding by current copyright laws when publishing or displaying copies of Special Collections material in print or electronic form. For more information, consult the appropriate librarian.
Photocopy decisions will be made by Special Collections staff on a case-by-case basis. Patrons are responsible for obtaining permission to publish from copyright holders.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection includes the records from the Scottish Brigade Alumnae association and the Scottish Brigade. The series included are: Scottish Brigade Alumnae Records; Scottish Brigade Alumnae Photographic and Video Material; Official Brigade Records; Scottish Brigade Performance Material; Scottish Brigade Photographic Material; Scottish Brigade Publicity Clippings; Stephen F. Austin Senior High School Yearbooks; and Scottish Brigade Memorabilia and Scrapbooks.

The Alumnae records include the organizational documents, financial reports, plans for the luncheon and scholarship reports as well as photographs and photo albums of the Alumnae Association activities and luncheons.

The Scottish Brigade records include organizational documents, performance records and plans and photographs of Scottish Brigade members, performances and events. In addition it contains an extensive series of Scottish Brigade memorabilia.

Materials are arranged as Alumnae Records or Brigade records and then arranged by topic within each series. Whenever possible, dated materials are arranged chronologically. The collection is housed in 12 boxes and also includes two oversize items.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series is comprised of 28 folders housed in 1 box and includes organizational documents, financial records, committee reports and other documents related to the founding and activities of the Scottish Brigade Alumnae Association. Of particular interest is the anthology book A Scottish Brigade Anthology which offers a concise and comprehensive history of the Scottish Brigade, its goals, members and founders.

Scottish Brigade Alumnae Photographic and Video Material

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series is comprised of 13 folders and 12 items housed in 3 boxes and includes the audiovisual and photographic records of the Scottish Brigade Alumnae association. Most of the items included relate to the Scottish Brigade luncheons although of particular interest are the three Scottish Brigade Performances videos which were created to be shown at the anniversary luncheons.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series is comprised of 9 folders housed in 1 box and includes the organizational documents of the Scottish Brigade, its financial documents, membership rosters and other administrative documents.

did.unittitle: Original constitution and bylaws of the Brigade and model constitutions
Mission statement and inaugural member list

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series is comprised of 37 folders and 4 items housed in 2 boxes and includes documents related to all aspects of the Scottish brigade’s performances. Marching plans, musical scores, song lyrics and marching handbooks are some of the more interesting documents in this series.

did.unittitle: Scottish Dances of the Drill Corps binder

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series is comprised of 7 folders and 3 items housed in 3 boxes. This series includes photo albums created by Scottish Brigade members, chronologically organized photos of Brigade members and Brigade events as well as a panoramic photo album containing photos of the entire Scottish Brigade for various years. Please note that Box 11 is an oversize box that contains items from several series and the panoramic photo album is an oversize item housed with the collection, but not in a box.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series is comprised of 9 folders housed in 3 boxes. This series includes newspaper clippings related to the performances and activities of the Scottish Brigade and its members as well as a run of the Austin Roundup, Stephen F. Austin High school newspaper from 1940-1978. Please note that Box 11 and Box 12 are oversize boxes, and Box 11 contains items from other series.

did.unittitle: Powell River Digester (V 16, No 11) & New Frontiers (Vol II, No I)
Various oversize clippings and newspaper pages
Stephen F. Austin Senior High School Yearbooks

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series is comprised of 5 folders housed in 1 box. This series includes newspaper clippings related to the performances and activities of the Scottish Brigade and its members as well as a run of the Austin Roundup, Stephen F. Austin High school newspaper from 1940-1978.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series is comprised of 7 folders and 25 items housed in 6 boxes with one loose item. This series includes costume items, props, marching flags, patches, scrapbooks and other memorabilia from the years that the Scottish Brigade was performing. Please note that Box 12 is an oversize box that contain items from other series and Item 2 is an oversize item housed with the collection, but not in a box.
